thread.title: Did nobody offer him a seat?! Rod Stewart wears disguise to travel by tube to London O2 concert - and he went unnoticed!
thread.title_full: Did nobody offer him a seat?! Rod Stewart wears disguise to travel by tube to London O2 concert - and he went unnoticed!

author: Lara Martin
title: Did nobody offer him a seat?! Rod Stewart wears disguise to travel by tube to London O2 concert - and he went unnoticed!
text:
What did Rod say to talk Penny out of a boob job ? Share this video Watch Next 
Fans praised the couple for their “normality”, leaving hundreds of comments on the images laughing about Rod’s attempt at a disguise and asking for an update as to whether he was noticed. 
“Love that everyone around is oblivious they have a legend riding with them,” said one Instagram user. “I’m in awe!” 
A second joked of the notoriously crowded commuter trains: “Now there’s someone I wouldn’t mind being squashed against!” 
A third pointed out there was a very modern reason why commuters may have walked past him without noticing: “Don’t worry, everyone is looking down at their phone!” Rod was en route to his London O2 Arena concert, pictured on stage. (Photo: Getty) Rod's shows had been rescheduled from November, when a throat infection forced him to postpone (Photo: Getty) 
Meanwhile, a fourth fan queried why Rod was standing in the photo, jokingly questioning if that meant nobody had offered the 72-year-old rockstar a seat. 
“You think someone would have given the old boy a seat after all his hard graft,” joked the Instagram user. 
Another had words of wisdom for the star: “Next time I think it might look a tiny bit less suspicious if you dare to leave the shades in the pocket while going by the Tube!” A laughing emoji was also posted. It was the last date on his 2016 tour (Photo: Getty) The superstar isn't the first to get the tube to their own gig (Photo: Getty) Rihanna famously got the tube to the BRITs (Photo: Twitter) 
Rod was off to London’s O2 Arena for the last date on his From Gasoline Alley To Another Country: Hits 2016 Tour. It was rearranged from November after a throat infection forced him to cancel the original date. 
Rod isn’t the first celebrity to choose the London Underground when it comes to making their way to the O2 Arena, situated over in Greenwich, east London. 
Noel Gallagher, Jay Z, Rihanna, Chris Martin and Nicole Scherzinger have all been spied on the tube in the past, giving the commuters who noticed them a real treat in rush hour. Like us on Facebook
